Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Must POST be non-idempotent?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=40455398; y=W7RNKMhbwG_5kNR1SvfS9aJYMB0V1HpzPjvITT5OTabIfjHLTiRIlQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: JulianReschke

Julian Reschke wrote:
> 
> 
> Marc de Graauw wrote:
>  > ...
>  > And one issue is still open: if I have some logic where I want the 
> server to
>  > create the URI but the logic is idempotent, what do I do?
>  > ...
> 
> I've been proposing ADDMEMBER
> (<http://greenbytes. de/tech/webdav/ draft-reschke- http-addmember- 
> 00.html 
> <http://greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/draft-reschke-http-addmember-00.html>>),
> but was told it doesn't add anything to POST. I disagree with that (and
> so do others), but hadn't the energy to follow up on this one.

Hm, I have to take that back. ADDMEMBER of course is not itempotent, 
because repeating a request will lead to another resource being created.

So you'll need something in the message that allows a server to detect a 
duplicate of a request.

Best regards, Julian
